ygData.subject: RE: Forage and Sense heading (was Re: Sonorous Clouding message)
ygData.msgSnippet: Can someone explain how to setup the forage command to a movement key?  I have always used the standard arrow keys for movement.  I have forage hotkeyed.
ygData.messageBody:
Can someone explain how to setup the forage command to a movement key? I
have always used the standard arrow keys for movement. I have forage
hotkeyed.

Galtin of E'ci

> -----Original Message-----
> From: jhenders@... [SMTP:jhenders@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, August 31, 1999 8:42 AM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Forage and Sense heading (was Re: Sonorous
> Clouding message)
>
> From: jhenders@...
>
> On Tue, Aug 31/99, Talies the Wanderer <snicker@...> wrote:
> >
> > Ahh - that explains the problem. I'm lucky enough that I had a backup
> of
> > my EQ files when my hard drive crashed the other day. I never changed
> my
> > bound keys, so I have left and right as 'A' and 'D' respectively.
> > Conveniently, this is also what user defined 5 and 6 are set to. I have
> > sense heading on one, and forage on the other. Life's good for da bard
> ;)
> > (I also have "Corpse" set to User 5 and 6 in bank 5 for when I'm trying
> to
> > do a speed corpse retrieval)
>
> By the time I heard of this dual bind trick I already had every page
> mapped out with various hotkeys and I didn't want to have to reorganize
> them to fit so the movement keys wouldn't do something I didn't want on
> one of the various pages. I'd hate to sit down when trying to run from a
> mob because I was accidently on the wrong macro page. :)
>
>
